name: Philodendron 'Sodiroi'
description: Philodendron sodiroi is an epiphytic aroid native to tropical regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Araceae family and features climbing or trailing growth (60-300 cm long) with large, dramatic, heart-shaped to arrow-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive silver variegation along the veins. The plant displays a climbing/trailing growth habit. The name Philodendron means "tree lover" in Greek, referring to its epiphytic growth habit. Many species exhibit dramatic color changes as leaves mature, with new growth often showing vibrant red, pink, or orange hues that fade to green. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds visual interest with its attractive silver-veined foliage. It's popular among aroid enthusiasts for its unique leaf pattern.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
